item.title: orangerful add a quote by Brent Crawford
item.description: "These kids are all trying so hard to be weird. I'm genuinely weird, so I can spot the effort a mile away." -- Brent Crawford

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know. For me, the spark that turns an acquaintance into a friend has usually been kindled by some shared enthusiasm . . . At fifteen, I couldn't say two words about the weather or how I was doing, but I could come up with a paragraph or two about the album <i>Charlie Parker with Strings.</i> In high school, I made the first real friends I ever had because one of them came up to me at lunch and started talking about the Cure." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Like Lincoln, I would like to believe the ballot is stronger than the bullet. Then again, he said that before he got shot." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Buffy's high school was built on top of a vortex of evil, the Hellmouth. And whose wasn't?" -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "When I think about my relationship with America, I feel like a battered wife: Yeah, he knocks me around a lot, but boy, he sure can dance." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "The true American patriot is by definition skeptical of the government." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Behind every bad law, a deep fear." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Oh my dear, idealists are the cruelest monsters of them all." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "The only thing more dangerous than an idea is a belief." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Mo Willems
item.description: "A book, being a physical object, engenders a certain respect that zipping electrons cannot. Because you cannot turn a book off, because you have to hold it in your hands, because a book sits there, waiting for you, whether you think you want it or not, because of all these things, a book is a friend. Itâ€™s not just the content, but the physical being of a book that is there for you always and unconditionally." -- Mo Willems

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Weekends don't count unless you spend them doing something completely pointless." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "I am certain there is too much certainty in the world." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Frank Portman
item.description: "High School is the penalty for transgressions yet to be specified." -- Frank Portman

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "In a world like this one, only the random makes sense." -- Libba Bray

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I'm just saying it's not all sand castles and ninjas." -- Libba Bray

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Dude, this is a stoner conversation and we're not even high" -- Libba Bray

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "Cake or death?" -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Henry Murger
item.description: "The first duty of wine is to be red. Don't talk to me of your white wines." -- Henry Murger

item.title: orangerful add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut
